course_description: Gross anatomy, histology, and medical imaging.  Anatomical terms, structures, and relationships emphasizing functional significance and application in clinical anesthesia situations. Laboratory provides demonstrations on models, prosections, and digital media.  Course topics align with ANES 536A Anesthesiology Practice I and  ANES 505B Human Patient Simulation Lab II.
